Subjective: Sore throat x 3 days. Fever this AM. Started with cough last week, now resolved. Painful swallowing, unbearable. Took paracetamol & ibuprofen, minimal relief. No shortness of breath. Able to swallow fluids, but painful. No runny nose. No sick contacts, but friend had abscess. Concern for abscess. Had sore throat years ago, took antibiotics as child. No smoking/alcohol.
Objective: Vitals: Temp 38.3 C. Saturation 98%. Ears: Left TM clear, air-filled. Right ear canal slightly red, TM normal. Neck: Small, non-pathological submandibular lymph nodes. Throat: Uvula midline. Pharyngeal arches slightly red. Tonsils slightly enlarged, bilateral slough, not kissing. Lungs: Vesicular breath sounds bilaterally, no adventitious sounds.
Assessment: Viral pharyngitis. No signs of abscess. Fever, sore throat, tonsillar exudates.
Plan:
1. Explanation: Viral infection, antibiotics not indicated. 
2. Meds: Paracetamol 500mg q6h PRN, Ibuprofen 400mg q8h PRN. 
3. Lifestyle: Increase fluid intake. Cold drinks/popsicles for pain relief. 
4. Safety Netting: Return if worsening symptoms, shortness of breath, inability to swallow. 
5. Follow-up: As needed.
